Civil War America; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865; Thompson, Meriwether Jeff, 1826-1876; Missouri--History; Missouri--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-quarter length portrait of Missouri State Guard Colonel Meriwether Jeff Thompson in uniform.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: A. L'arcombe
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Meriwether Jeff Thompson (January 22, 1826- September 5, 1876) became a brigadier general in the Missouri State Guard during the American Civil War. He also served the Confederate Army as a cavalry commander, and had the unusual distinction of having a ship in the Confederate Navy named for him. Thompson organized the Missouri troops called the "Swamp Rats."
